definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
lit. the color blue is made out of indigo but is more vivid than indigo (idiom)/fig. the student surpasses the master
pinyin: qing1 chu1 yu2 lan2 er2 sheng4 yu2 lan2

sentences.english: Non-truth derived from the nature of truth, is inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 非真理源出於真理的本質，是不可避免的。

sentences.english: The image of youth comes from the artist's self-reflection and expression of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 少年的形象是出於作者對自我情緒的反思和表達。

sentences.english: The German Emperor took revenge on China by making thinas difficult in the ceremony and propriety.
sentences.chinese: 出於報復心理，德皇在禮儀問題上刁難載灃使團。

sentences.english: The calcaneus projects backward behind the ankle .
sentences.chinese: 跟骨突出於踝部的後方。

sentences.english: What does the ETS have changes in TOFEL for?
sentences.chinese: 您覺得ETS在託福上作的修改是出於什麼目的？

sentences.english: Mmmm that it's all for the best?
sentences.chinese: 嗯，那一切都出於好意嗎？

sentences.english: Some old people are often condemned to live alone.
sentences.chinese: 一些老人常出於無奈而獨自生活。

sentences.english: She broke them up out of jealousy.
sentences.chinese: 出於嫉妒之心，她離間了他們的關係。

sentences.english: Therefore, in its origin, Standby was a substitution of bank guaranties.
sentences.chinese: 因此，從起源上來講，備用證的產生是出於替代。

sentences.english: If so, what is the reason behind it?
sentences.chinese: 如果屬實，是出於什麼原因？

sentences.english: To be respectful of one another and the relationship, you should try and keep the discussion (or argument) focused to the topic at hand.
sentences.chinese: 出於對雙方和彼此關係的尊重，你應該爭取就事論事。

sentences.english: Scholars suspect the story of Archimedes isn't even entirely true.
sentences.chinese: 學者們懷疑，阿基米德的故事可能出於杜撰。

sentences.english: Just heard when newly flying price, stemming from likes and expected, does not think expensively .
sentences.chinese: 剛聽說新飛度價格時，出於喜歡和期望，並不覺得貴。

sentences.english: For some reason, I’ve never upgraded.
sentences.chinese: 出於某些原因，我從沒有升級。

sentences.english: He told police that he had acted in self-defence.
sentences.chinese: 他對警方說他的行爲是出於自衛。

definition: because of/on the basis of/in view of/on account of
as for/as to/to go so far as to
to be in/to lie in/to consist in/to depend on/to rest with
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to make sth difficult/to create obstacles
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to pick a quarrel/to start a fight
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
